moves.1. e4: im quite proud of the way i handled this match (being the amateur that i am)
the next chain of moves was meant to free my horse and bishop from the pawn attack...
moves.19. Nb3 Bxb5: and i had to say goodbye to my rook
moves.20. Nc3 Bxf1:
at this point, i dont think anyone would have believed that i could pull off a win.
(2 pawns, 1 bishop n 1 rook down with nothing to show for it)
moves.21. Qxf1 a6: but this is where my last-ditch plan begins....
moves.29. b8=Q+ Bxb8 30. Qxb8+ Qd8 31. Qe5+ Qe: i can see he wants my queen out of the way....
moves.33. Qxg7: -as she alone seems to have caused him a lot of trouble
moves.33... Qf8 34. Qd4 Rh6: now the queen no longer has to protect her rook, which is now guarded by the horse
